definition: secure as a city protected by a wall of metal and a moat of boiling water (idiom)/well fortified/invulnerable to attack
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled

sentences.english: Do pair of hackers trade on stockjobber net with respect to impregnable ?
sentences.chinese: 證券公司網上交易對黑客就固若金湯？

sentences.english: The old Dutch fort with its thick high walls looks virtually impregnable.
sentences.chinese: 古老的荷蘭城堡城牆又厚又高，看起來幾乎固若金湯。

sentences.english: The submarine is invulnerable to attack while at sea.
sentences.chinese: 潛艇固若金湯，海上攻擊打不倒。

definition: running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
to convert an enemy into a friend (idiom)
Horizontal Alliance, clique of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
to have been through the hardships of life/to have been through the mill
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
